dvi.eli5: DVI is an older plug that connects your computer to a screen.
dvi.boss: DVI (Digital Visual Interface) is a video display interface standard for transmitting digital video to monitors.
dvi.sysadmin: DVI supports digital (DVI-D), analog (DVI-A), or both (DVI-I) video signals and is common on older GPUs and monitors.
dvi.use_case: Used to connect a PC tower to a monitor before HDMI became common.

usbcdisplay.eli5: It’s a cable that powers your screen and sends video using the same plug.
usbcdisplay.boss: USB-C Display refers to video output over a USB-C connector using protocols like DisplayPort Alt Mode or Thunderbolt.
usbcdisplay.sysadmin: Modern USB-C ports support DisplayPort or Thunderbolt for video output, allowing displays to be driven over a single USB-C cable.
usbcdisplay.use_case: Used to connect a laptop to a 4K monitor and charge it using one cable.

keyboard.eli5: A keyboard is how you type words into a computer.
keyboard.boss: A keyboard is a primary input device used to interact with computers via physical or virtual key presses.
keyboard.sysadmin: Keyboards use USB, PS/2, or Bluetooth interfaces and may include media keys, macros, or ergonomic layouts for input control.
keyboard.use_case: Used for typing emails, writing code, or gaming commands.
